file_content.text: Where were you?
Bombing five worlds to dust. I made holos of it. Do you want a copy?
Father was on Zakuul. He used the Outlander to attack our home.
I don't remember him being so funny when he was alive.
Am I laughing?!
You've never laughed.
Our Knights failed us. They must regain their honor. Send them to the dueling circle in pairs. They'll battle to the death.
Finding the Outlander will be harder, with half our Knights dead.
The survivors will be motivated.
You know my command. Go.
Millions dead. Their blood is on our hands.
We didn't destroy those worlds. Your children did.
The atrocities on those planets were committed to hurt the Alliance, but we're not responsible for them.
What are you talking about? What's happened now?
Warships from the Eternal Fleet bombarded five planets in a coordinated assault. The death toll is unimaginable. Whole cities, leveled.
Arcann issued a statement saying those worlds were protecting us--and their destruction was justice for our attacks on Zakuul. A lie, of course, but no one can prove it.
Arcann's desperate. He can't find us, so he's taking the galaxy hostage.
There's only one way to stop this. Arcann wants to isolate us. Let him. We should publicly deny we have allies on any planets.
Innocents must not die for us.
You can't protect people from his reprisals--or stop those who believe in your Alliance from joining it.
We need to send our own message. Expose Arcann's lies. Show people the truth.
Let's fight the propaganda.
Propaganda wars are a quagmire. The louder we shout, the more people Arcann kills. The public will turn against us.
Arcann can't afford to destroy any more planets without sending the rest over to our side. There won't be another attack like this one.
He can't keep that up.
I'm sure that comes as great comfort to the survivors.
Koth flipped his hydrospanner! He tried to take the Gravestone!
What do you mean, "take" it?
Said he was quitting the Alliance! I fought him off, but he took a shuttle instead. Len and Ralo left with him.
Opening a holochannel to the shuttle....
Never been one for goodbyes. This was a long time coming. Too many innocent people are dying--and not just because of Arcann.
What happened with Firebrand was the end for me. I can't ignore who you are, Commander--and I won't follow you anymore.
Turn that shuttle around. Give me a chance to make things right.
Come back, and we'll talk.
There's nothing you can say. I'll never trust you again.
You've always been weak. Go on--I don't need you.
Good riddance.
I fooled myself into believing you had a destiny to save us. I guess the joke's on me.
You're betraying the Alliance. There's only one punishment for that.
You're a dead man.
I look forward to the day you and Arcann kill each other.
Koth, stop. If you do this, there's no going back.
I'll miss you, Lana.
The shuttle jumped to hyperspace. We lost him.
We cannot be distracted by a temper tantrum. Five planets lie in ruin. The dead must be avenged.
I just heard the news. We have to respond to Arcann's attack.
No. That's precisely what he wants.
Is it?
We already have more objectives than resources--but we can make a course adjustment.
This kind of destruction will bring fear and chaos. We should do whatever we can to limit that.
We should protect survivors.
I can get food and medical supplies to people who need them.
I'll organize security patrols to hold off any pirates or crime syndicates seeking to take advantage.
People now know Arcann for what he is. Let's use that. The angrier people get, the more it will destabilize the enemy.
Encourage more uprisings.
Fanning the flames could prove dangerous, but it might reveal new friends.
The real trick is keeping those new friends alive long enough to recruit them.
We've been fighting the enemy on his terms for too long. The Eternal Fleet is out there. Let's take the Gravestone hunting.
Hit Arcann where it hurts.
We'll have to go after lone warships. Use hit-and-run tactics.
Aygo can help with battle strategies.
We're only delaying the inevitable. Sooner or later, my children must answer for what they've done.
Koth, come in. What's going on?
Said he was quitting the Alliance! I fought him off, but he took a shuttle instead. Len went with him.
Part of me wishes you could fix this. But it's too late. I can't trust you.
You can. I'll show you.
I fooled myself into believing we had something. Guess the joke's on me.
I don't know what I saw in you.
I know.
Koth's gone--I can't just ignore that.
Vengeance can wait.
Senya's right. Koth made his choice.
You're right. Forget Koth.
You know what? I don't care--do what you want.
I'm done. You deal with it.
Where are you going?
Away.
At this rate, the Alliance will destroy itself.
Arcann wants a response. We won't give it to him--not directly.
What do you have in mind?
We use the common people against him. Fan the flames of rebellion. It's risky, but we need more allies.
We must respond to my son's attacks.
Koth is doing what he does best: running from his responsibilities. Do not do the same.
You're right. I'm sorry. We need to respond to these attacks.
I can't afford to be selfish.
You may not like him, but Koth helped build the Alliance and he's gone.
How can you be so cold?
Don't lecture me about responsibility. I'm in charge here.
Watch your tone.
Then act like it.
Enough! This is exactly what Arcann wants.
People are dead because of the Alliance. We have to respond one way or another.
As much as I will miss Koth... Senya is right. We need to keep a level head and focus.
My son's attacks cannot go unanswered. We must respond swiftly and loudly.
I'll talk to Hylo--see if her people can sneak in food and medical supplies to the wounded.
We're not ready to take on the whole fleet. Our best bet is to isolate task groups--pick them off one by one.
We already have more objectives than resources--but we can make a course adjustment.
This kind of destruction will bring fear and chaos. We should do whatever we can to limit that.
We should protect survivors.
I'll organize security patrols to hold off any pirates or crime syndicates seeking to take advantage.
People now know Arcann for what he is. Let's use that. The angrier people get, the more it will destabilize the enemy.
Encourage more uprisings.
Fanning the flames could prove dangerous, but it might reveal new friends.
The real trick is keeping those new friends alive long enough to recruit them.
We've been fighting the enemy on his terms for too long. The Eternal Fleet is out there. Let's take the Gravestone hunting.
Hit Arcann where it hurts.
Aygo can help with battle strategies.
We're only delaying the inevitable. Sooner or later, my children must answer for what they've done.
No. That's precisely what he wants.
Is it?
